snippet: James F. Dobbins said the present election impasse in Afghanistan threatens more division in the country.
abstract: Veteran diplomat James F Dobbins, who has served as United States special envoy for Afghanistan and Pakistan, is leaving government; departure follows a tumultuous year in which Obama administration settled on plan for withdrawing from Afghanistan but ran into roadblock in trying to pursue peace talks with the Taliban; in interview, Dobbins takes a hopeful, if somewhat guarded, view of the troubled political situation in Afghanistan.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Declan Walsh contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: James F. Dobbins said the present election impasse in Afghanistan threatens more division in the country.

headline.main: Envoy to Afghanistan and Pakistan Will Leave Post
headline.print_headline: Envoy to Afghanistan and Pakistan Will Leave Post

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
